00018    /*
00019    * Strip trailing whitespace from a string.
00020    */
00021    int rStrip(std::string& str)
00022    {
00023       size_t found;
00024       std::string whitespaces(" \t\n\r");
00025       found = str.find_last_not_of(whitespaces);
00026       if (found != std::string::npos) {
00027         str.erase(found + 1);
00028         return int(found + 1);
00029       } else {
00030         str.clear();
00031         return 0;
00032       }
00033    }
00034 
00035    /*
00036    * Read string, and compare to expected value. 
00037    *
00038    * Throw Exception if input value differs from expected value.
00039    */
00040    void checkString(std::istream& in, std::string& expected)
00041    {
00042       std::string actual;
00043       in >> actual;
00044       if ( actual != expected ) {
00045          Log::file() << "Error in checkString"     << std::endl;
00046          Log::file() << "Expected: " <<  expected  << std::endl;
00047     Log::file() << "Scanned:  " <<  actual    << std::endl;
00048          UTIL_THROW("Incorrect string");
00049       };
00050    }
00051 
00052    /*
00053    * Return std::string representation of an integer.
00054    */
00055    std::string toString(int n)
00056    {
00057       std::stringstream ss;
00058       ss << n;
00059       return ss.str();
00060    }
00061 
00062 
00063    /*
00064    * Get the next line of input skipping an blank lines.
00065    */
00066    void getNextLine(std::istream& in, std::string& line)
00067    {
00068       bool hasLine = false;
00069       while (!hasLine) {
00070          std::getline(in, line);
00071          if (!line.empty()) {
00072             hasLine = true;
00073          }
00074       }
00075    }
00076 
00077    /*
00078    * Transfer the next line of input to a stringstream
00079    */
00080    void getLine(std::istream& in, std::stringstream& line)
00081    {
00082       std::string string;
00083       line.str(string);
00084       getline(in, string);
00085       line.str(string);
00086    }
00087 
00088    /*
00089    * Transfer the next line of input to an sstream
00090    */
00091    void getNextLine(std::istream& in, std::stringstream& line)
00092    {
00093       std::string string;
00094       line.str(string);
00095       bool hasLine = false;
00096       while (!hasLine) {
00097          std::getline(in, string);
00098          if (!string.empty()) {
00099             hasLine = true;
00100          }
00101       }
00102       line.str(string);
00103    }
